Acrin Construction Yard.description: Acquires tiles, clears tiles and constructs buildings as well as generates minerals and influence
Acrin Construction Yard.name: Acrin Construction Yard

Acrin Midnight Chorus.description: Produces Acrin units as well as increases loyalty and generates algae
Acrin Midnight Chorus.name: Acrin Midnight Chorus

Fermentation Vat.flavor: Have you ever smelled a mycoprotein vat? It's worse than a barracks toilet on shellfish day. And that's just for making edible sludge. The stuff that's bred in the FermVats… it’ll send you on a trip that nobody comes back from. We called it algae, but that's just a convenient word for something that doesn't share even a fundamental biology with us. And the Voice cult *eat* it.
Fermentation Vat.name: Fermentation Vat

Antimatter Plant.flavor: A great scientist explained this to me once—we generate antiprotons and positrons then fire them into a decelerator to make antihydrogen. We stabilize large quantities of this in synchrotrons, for use in—well, whatever you need insanely dangerous antimatter for.
Antimatter Plant.name: Antimatter Plant

Cryo Fabricator.flavor: It might have been a Chinese Room, whose motivations and thoughts are fundamentally obscure to us, but the ZEPHON AI definitely knew itself and what makes it work best. We built a Fab that could mimic ZEPHON-grade hardware. If we wanted to survive, we needed to steal from the best.
Cryo Fabricator.name: Cryo Fabricator

Construction Yard.description: Acquires tiles, clears tiles, produces Engineers and constructs buildings as well as generates minerals and influence
Construction Yard.flavor: We built things, at first, how we'd always done. With sweat and vigor. In the construction yard, there was nothing fancy--diggers, trucks, cranes, geopolymer concretes, girders. But, even with that primitive tech, we could build anything.
Construction Yard.name: Construction Yard

Sky Fortress.description:
Produces Cyber aircraft, increases housing and loyalty as well as generates chips
Initially produces  Ophanim Carrier
    <style color='GUI/Gray'/>Large mechanical flyer equipped to deploy numerous drones
Sky Fortress.flavor: At first glance, none of these machines should have been able to fly. Where were the wings, the blades, the engines, the control surfaces? Our techs told us the secret was “a small ratio of antigrav to mass.” I took their word for it—better than just counting on faith that you wouldn’t fall out of the sky.
Sky Fortress.name: Sky Fortress

Synthetic Printer.description:
Produces Cyber infantry as well as generates minerals and chips
Initially produces  Ishim Enforcers
    <style color='GUI/Gray'/>Bio-mech infantry that alternate between high-power and low-power attacks while healing their wounds
Synthetic Printer.flavor: Printing a soldier? The process seemed like nonsense. On the first day these factories went online, I watched them work and it was… out of this world. The printing tech could patch up organics and manufacture synthetics without missing a beat. First we used these facilities to improve the human body—eventually, we started printing them from scratch.
Synthetic Printer.name: Synthetic Printer

Network Splitter.description:
Produces Cyber operations as well as generates influence and chips
Initially produces  Interference Protocols
    <style color='GUI/Gray'/>Temporarily reduces accuracy of target enemy unit
Network Splitter.flavor: Working in ZEPHON's shadow? It was an ambitious idea. The AI had already built a whole global network, and we could use a fraction of it for sabotage and cyber warfare. It was one hell of a risk. If ZEPHON had noticed us, we might have been wiped out. But maybe… it did notice us. Maybe it was studying us.
Network Splitter.name: Network Splitter

Antigrav Assembler.description:
Produces Cyber vehicles as well as generates research and chips
Initially produces  Exousia Marauder
    <style color='GUI/Gray'/>Large mechanical hover transport from which units can disembark further
Antigrav Assembler.flavor: I thought antigravity would just be a logistical innovation. Sure, keeping machines flying is tough, but now you didn't have to worry that a pothole would take out your troop transport. Yet those machines were only the beginning. Antigravity wasn't just a scientific parlor trick. It was a secret to new kinds of life.
Antigrav Assembler.name: Antigrav Assembler

Sealed Hermitage.flavor: You put a maniple of Voice hermits into chambers, seal them up, and never open them again. You'd think they'd die in hours, from lack of air, but the believers say they're alive. And certainly the chambers start producing 'echoes'—alternate futures and pasts, tangible, controllable. Just never, ever open the chambers.
Sealed Hermitage.name: Sealed Hermitage

Power Plant.flavor: The first time we got the lights back on, it was a miracle. We couldn’t wage war with salvaged gasoline and shitty generators. Some civilians grumbled at the idea of burning coal and gas—two elements that once nearly doomed our planet—but our planet was already doomed. We were on the brink of taking it back. This wasn't the time for such dissent.
Power Plant.name: Power Plant

Greenhouse Farm.flavor: Our first harvests didn’t account for the mutated soil. That cost… so many lives. We never took food for granted again after that. Every edible scrap would be accounted for. As long as we had power, no one would go hungry. Of course, our enemies were all too happy to see us starve.”
Greenhouse Farm.name: Greenhouse Farm

Headquarters.description: Produces heroes and generates baseline resources
Headquarters.flavor: You couldn’t wage war without a secure home base. All of our defensive strategies came back to protecting this structure. If it fell, then all was lost.
Headquarters.name: Headquarters

Assembly Hangar.description:
Produces Human aircraft as well as generates minerals and influence
Initially produces  TH-3 Corsair
    <style color='GUI/Gray'/>Large flying mechanical transport skilled in evasive maneuvers
Assembly Hangar.flavor: The weak point of every craft we sent up was the pilot. Pilots can pass out, succumb to G-Forces, bleed to death… and that’s just to start. Producing quality aircraft meant designing around those weaknesses. We had to prioritize the people over the machinery when getting these in the air…
Assembly Hangar.name: Assembly Hangar

Barracks.description:
Produces Human infantry as well as increases housing and loyalty
Initially produces  Militants
    <style color='GUI/Gray'/>Basic infantry with faster fire rate at close range
Barracks.flavor: You never won any war without the grunts. Before you cracked open any advanced technology or gave into the Voice, you needed armed bodies primed for death. Great soldiers could come out of the infantry ranks—but they had to survive first.
Barracks.name: Barracks

Orbital Uplink.description:
Produces Human operations as well as generates research and influence
Initially produces  Satellite Scan
    <style color='GUI/Gray'/>Reveals tiles
Orbital Uplink.flavor: The ground part of this system was familiar enough—a set of high-powered transmitters and dishes. But what it was communicating with wasn't—the wreck of the human satellite network mingled with the destroyed alien fleet. The clever bit was using the former to manipulate the latter for benefit on the ground. It mostly worked.
Orbital Uplink.name: Orbital Uplink

Automated Factory.description:
Produces Human vehicles as well as generates minerals and research
Initially produces  Outrider
    <style color='GUI/Gray'/>Large mechanical transport with light equipment and excellent reconnaissance capabilities
Automated Factory.flavor: Another classic problem of warfare: whether you needed to haul weapons, supplies or people, you needed hardware that could make the journey. We started small, of course. In time we built transports and tanks that went far beyond the capacity of old world engineers.
Automated Factory.name: Automated Factory

Administration Complex.flavor: Ugh. This place. The center of organization for our city. Yes, I appreciate that it demonstrated competence—that it organized our society and economy, that it impressed our neighbors. But I just couldn't be near bureaucrats, with their triplicate forms and rubber stamps and cardboard suits. Give me a frontline battle over form 2B(II)i.
Administration Complex.name: Administration Complex

Holo Theater.flavor: An immersive simulation structure, able to give people a shared dream. The best of us used these to escape our hellish world. The worst of us… the foul-minded… they used it for brainwashing. I still don’t know what became of some of those experiments. They may still be suffering to this day.
Holo Theater.name: Holo Theater

Mineral Extractor.flavor: The top brass called it a 'mineral extractor', like we were selling it to ourselves, but we all knew it was just a mine. Yes, it had fancy machines; yes, it prospected, excavated and backfilled automatically. But it was a mine for all that and it was hard work.
Mineral Extractor.name: Mineral Extractor

Habitation Block.flavor: How many people do you think you could pack into an average home? So that they'd be happy living there, indefinitely? How close could everyone be? What suffices for personal space? The architect who sketched the hab-bloc was a devilish genius. People sleep and live cheek-by-jowl—but it works.
Habitation Block.name: Habitation Block

Reaver Construction Yard.description: Acquires tiles, clears tiles and constructs buildings as well as generates minerals and influence
Reaver Construction Yard.name: Reaver Construction Yard

Reaver Barracks.description: Produces Reaver units as well as increases housing and loyalty
Reaver Barracks.name: Reaver Barracks

Research Laboratory.flavor: Techs, researchers, scientists—they all holed up here. When I was younger—stupider—I thought this was where the soft hid from the harshness of war. That’s what they wanted us to think, of course. Some of the most monstrous minds found their place here. Why pull the trigger…when you could make the gun?
Research Laboratory.name: Research Laboratory

Quantum Manipulator.flavor: Cracking the secrets of quantum physics? Easy. Putting that knowledge to work on the battlefield? Astronomically expensive and nearly impossible. We needed a special facility that could… what was it? “Extract quantum-tier processing power out of Chips?” It made my head hurt to try and process the math that made this place tick.
Quantum Manipulator.name: Quantum Manipulator

Transuranium Stabilizer.flavor: Now, this, I won't pretend to understand. I know the transuranic elements are unstable. I know that in that instability, there's huge amounts of latent energy. I don't know how the machines worked that stopped it escaping—that made those elements into something dense and unearthly strong. I don't know if there's anyone alive who understands, to be fair.
Transuranium Stabilizer.name: Transuranium Stabilizer

Paean to the Dawn.description:
Produces Voice flyers as well as generates research and algae
Initially produces  Iok Swarm
    <style color='GUI/Gray'/>Biological flyers that vomit acid and devour nearby units to heal themselves
Paean to the Dawn.flavor: I spoke to an ancient Acrin once—he claimed to be the last of his race's pre-Voice anchorites—and he told me that the Voice is more of a song, cycling, that sings of beginnings and endings, that time is a loop, singing the universe into being. I told him I hoped we were at the Dawn, about to fly into a new world, and he smiled, sadly.
Paean to the Dawn.name: Paean to the Dawn

Midnight Chorus.description:
Produces Voice infantry as well as increases loyalty and generates algae
Initially produces  Abkluth Dragoons
    <style color='GUI/Gray'/>Biological melee bleedwalkers that can take control of enemy Abkluth
Midnight Chorus.flavor: My scouts found a Chorus building once. It was like a natural arena, an amplifier. They talked to me as they approached, as they fell apart under its song, as they walked themselves into its portal. I listened to the song and I wanted to go with them too, but I was miles away. I never saw them again, but the Voice had new soldiers the next day.
Midnight Chorus.name: Midnight Chorus

Masked Hymnal.description:
Produces Voice operations as well as generates influence and algae
Initially produces  Hymn of Decay
    <style color='GUI/Gray'/>Temporarily deals damage on target tile
Masked Hymnal.flavor: Enlightenment is a worthy goal, say the Voice's devotees, but not the only goal. Sometimes the Voice is a goal in and of itself. I don't pretend to understand their abstruse religion, but they have a direct contact with their... their gods. And the gods will talk back, even answer prayers.
Masked Hymnal.name: Masked Hymnal

Canticle of Dusk.description:
Produces Voice creatures as well as generates food and algae
Initially produces  Dark Vassael
    <style color='GUI/Gray'/>Large biological creature with a horrifying attack that reduces enemy morale
Canticle of Dusk.flavor: Not all alterations of the Voice achieve enlightenment, I'm told, especially those subacrin in some way. Nor do they die. Those failed drift out of the passion, healed, but changed, often bestial. I wonder if this is where the Acrin's weird creatures come from—failed zealots—or whether they are just creatures native to their home, who joined them in the journey across the stars.
Canticle of Dusk.name: Canticle of Dusk

ZEPHON Construction Yard.description: Acquires tiles, clears tiles and constructs buildings as well as generates minerals and influence
ZEPHON Construction Yard.name: ZEPHON Construction Yard

ZEPHON Synthetic Printer.description: Produces ZEPHON units as well as generates minerals and chips
ZEPHON Synthetic Printer.name: ZEPHON Synthetic Printer
